description: 1964 Chevrolet Corvette L76 Coupe For Sale in Novato, California  94945

Get ready to inspire your passion towards motoring with this 1964 Chevy Corvette L76 Coupe!  This two-door sports car features a sleek, athletic styling that has become an icon of the Corvette nameplate.  It is sure to capture the attention of anyone who sees it with striking Riverside Red paint complemented by a custom ordered white leather interior.  Powered by an L76 327 V-8 engine that is paired with 4-speed manual transmission, this handsome devil is all correct numbers matching and offers an impressive 365 horsepower.  With only 33,309 original miles you can rest assured that this Corvette will provide an enjoyable driving experience for many years to come.

The Chevy Corvette was first built for the 1953 model year and has seen production span though seven generations.  This 1964 model is part of the C2 generation and it carries the original look and luster from when it was first built.  The engine is from the Flint, Michigan plant and the car's assembly took place at the St. Louis, Missouri plant.  With three previous owners this Corvette has rarely been driven.  It has been under current ownership for the past 15 years with meticulous attention to detail invested into its care.  It has a 3:55 positraction rear-end ratio and comes with a new battery.  Also included with the sale are the original owners manual and keys.  Everything works as it should, including the clock.  This Corvette is originally an Oregon car, which has enabled its rust free presentation.  Very few 1964 Corvette L76s are still on the road. Fewer still is the number of road-worthy drivers in such fantastic, unrestored condition as this one.

This 1964 Chevrolet Corvette L76 Coupe has been kept smoke free and always garage kept.  This car has never seen bad weather and the only reason for selling such a classic gem is to make room.  Turn-key ready for its new owner, this Corvette is a must see/drive.  In fact, come see for yourself!  You will agree that you cannot find another '64 Corvette L76 Coupe dressed with Riverside Red paint, in this as new condition for the asking price.  If you are someone who appreciates the quality craftsmanship of classic sports car than you owe it to yourself to check out this '64 Vette.  This sports car is priced to sell so don't miss out on such an amazing opportunity to own the fast, fun, and fierce car of your dreams.  Call today for more information on how this classic automobile icon can be yours!

Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this absolutely stunning concours restored 1964 Chevrolet Corvette complete with the NOM 327 300 HP engine. This is a fully documented (with reciepts) $100K built from the ground up using all orginal or period correct parts. You are looking at the product of years in the making to make this stunning and rare car look and drive like it does today. Buy now for half of the build cost and win your local car show tomorrow.
HISTORY

For 1964 Chevrolet made only evolutionary changes to the Corvette. Besides the coupe's backbone window, the two simulated air intakes were eliminated from the hood, though their indentations remained. Also, the decorative air-exhaust vent on the coupe's rear pillar was made functional, but only on the left side. The car's rocker-panel trim lost some of its ribs and gained black paint between those ribs that remained; wheel covers were simplified; and the fuel filler/deck emblem gained concentric circles around its crossed-flags insignia. Inside, the original color-keyed steering wheel rim was now done in simulated walnut.

A few suspension refinements were made for 1964. The front coil springs were changed from constant-rate to progressive or variable-rate and were more tightly wound at the top, while leaf thickness of the rear transverse spring was also altered thus providing a more comfortable ride with no sacrifice in handling. Shock absorbers were reworked toward the same end. The 1964 Corvette arrived with a new standard shock containing within its fluid reservoir a small bag of Freon gas that absorbed heat. Chevy added more sound insulation and revised body and transmission mounts for the 1964 Corvette. It also fitted additional bushings to quiet the shift linkage and placed a new boot around the lever. The result was a more livable car for everyday transportation. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA

CLASSIC CAR RESTORATIONS:

The term "restoration" in context to the vintage car world has taken on a definition of its own. For some people, a restoration is simply painting a car and replacing items as needed, while for others, restoration means an extensive disassembly and overhaul, with each piece getting rebuilt or replaced.

As a consumer, it's important to understand the basics of restoration levels for it can impact classic car values substantially. There are hundreds of ways to “restore” a vintage car or truck including but not limited to the following: i).
Frame off restoration.
Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly. ii).
Rotisserie restoration.

These restorations are when the body (or body and frame on a unibody vehicle) are disassembled and restored utilizing a rotisserie. Body of vehicle is completely taken off the frame and restoration includes body, frame, floor pans (top and bottom), etc. these restorations tend to be extensive and costly and iii).
Cosmetic or “driver quality” restoration.

These restoration are typically limited to cosmetic items including paint and body, interior, trim and emblems, etc. Within the three levels or restoration mentioned above, there can be varying quality from an “in the garage / amateur” restoration to a high dollar professional “concours” restoration. There is a universal 100 point grading system rating classic car conditions ranging from 100 being excellent to 20 being unrestorable.
In addition to the levels of restoration above, it's important to understand the type of restoration as well for it can also impact value substantially. Type of restorations include: i).
Factory or stock restoration.

This type of restoration is geared towards restoring the car or truck to stock specs from the factory as if it were new. These types of restorations use original or oem (original equipment manufacturer) where possible. Factory original restorations tend to bring the highest dollars from collectors. ii).
Custom restoration.

These types of restorations are geared towards builder preference over factory stock. These can be refereed to as “customs” or “hot rods”. Typically these vehicles will have custom paint work, aftermarket wheels, suspension upgrades, power plant transplants, etc. A specific sector of custom restoration vehicles is “pro-touring” or “restomod / restomods” which are custom built with a more modern street performance and creature comforts than the original factory vehicle.
Please note that WWVA is not a restoration shop nor do we restore vehicles to any degree.
For questions on what type or level of restoration of any of our vehicles in inventory please call our vintage sales expert today at 1-877-422-2940.

This 1966 Sunfire Yellow Corvette is splendid example of what we believe to be an excellent older body-off restoration. The lines are clean, the paint is virtually immaculate, and the attention to detail is apparent You can see the detail of the restoration in everything, down to the rosette rivets and the bonding strips. An upgrade that was added to the car was replacing the transmission with a Richmond 5 speed. Shifting is smooth, easy, and only increases the driving experience. To add to that, the power steering is a welcome option that was included on this car. In 1966 backup lights became standard, as did Holley carburetors and few other nice details that really do make a difference: additional pleats in the seats for better comfort and weight distribution, fiberboard headliners were replaced with foam, and the Corvette script was added to the hood, just to name a few. This car has all of that. With the features and upgrades on this beautiful and easy-to-drive Corvette, it's easy to see why 1966 is such a popular model year, and this car is a prime example of that. Features: Sunfire Yellow and Black : 984/Bk 327/350HP 174 block 5 speed Richmond transmission factory side exhaust knock-off wheels near new BF Goodyear radial tires both soft and hard top teakwood steering wheel original AM/FM radio power antenna power steering

seller_name: Bid Network Online: Classic Car Auction
title: 1966 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible

description: 1966 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray Convertible for Sale in Burke, Virginia  22015.

Get ready for a wonderfully exciting driving experience in a car that is sure to turn heads on and off the road. Dressed in the most popular and original Nassau Blue, accented by a new white soft top, and complimented by a new black interior, this car features sleek and muscular styling - a legendary icon of American muscle. With a recent complete Frame-Off restoration to most NCRS specifications, this car speaks of originality and quality with many modern, less visible, upgraded internals.With only 250 miles on the drive-train since a full frame-off restoration, this car is practically brand new and ready to enjoy without concerns for any mechanical malfunctions.  It's a brand new classic old car!

The entire drive train has been completely rebuilt. Powered by the original, numbers-matching, 327 CID 300 HP V-8 engine, mated with the original 4-speed manual transmission, this Corvette sports the correct 4-barrel Holley carburetor and is upgraded with a roller cam and electronic ignition with the correct distributor, which has been re-curved to compensate for slightly reduced compression ratio for today's lower octane, lead-free premium gas.  It also comes with a new clutch and positraction differential with a 3.36:1 ratio for better fuel economy.  The side exhaust and new mufflers reduce noise, but produce a throaty sound when desired so that you can finally have the best of both worlds - comfort and performance. With only 250 miles since restoration, you can rest assured that this Corvette Sting Ray Convertible will provide an exciting and quality driving experience, laced with power and performance, for many years to come.

This Chevy C2 Corvette comes with many regular production options, including factory air conditioning with a rebuilt compressor and all new hoses, power steering, power windows, and 4-wheel power disc brakes.  The braking system, in particular, features a dual master cylinder, stainless steel sleeved wheel cylinders, and stainless steel brake lines.

Other restoration improvements include a rust-free powder- coated frame and completely rebuilt chassis with a correct new aluminum radiator, new expansion tank, and all new hoses. The fuel tank, fuel line, shocks, and all bushings were replaced. The body has all new weather-stripping, a replaced power window motor, and all new wiring harnesses.  A new safety plate windshield features correctly dated tinted glass matching the other dated tinted windows. The paint is the original lacquer that comes with some aging and minor imperfections; however, it is mostly in very good condition and speaks to the car's authenticity. With new correct-looking reproduction Bolt-on Knockoff wheels for optimal safety, as well as new smooth-running goldline radials, this classic is sure to capture lots of attention on the road and at the show. A Nassau Blue auxiliary hardtop also comes with the car.

The interior caters to the true Corvette enthusiast with new, comfortable leather seats and arm rest, new door panels, restored console, and new carpeting with heat reducing under- layment.  The car comes with a new teakwood steering wheel, restored telescopic steering column, and perfect eyebrows, complete with new dash knobs, a full set of beautifully restored gauges that resemble the instruments in an aircraft cockpit, and a new glove box and door.  It also comes with a completely restored and updated original AM/FM radio with 4- speaker stereo, solid state internals, and more powerful amplifiers. There's also a new interface for an MP3 player.

This Sting Ray Convertible runs great and handles with precision.  With no damage and having been fully restored with many upgrades, this car is in great condition, ready to drive, show, and most of all, enjoy! Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to own an excellent example of America's most cherished sports car!  Call today for more information on how you can get behind the wheel of this impressive, classic gem!

description: 1963 Chevrolet Corvette Sting Ray Convertible For Sale in South Jordan, Utah  84095

Get ready for the ultimate driving experience with this 1963 Chevy Corvette Sting Ray Convertible!  This two-door sports car features the handsome and athletic styling that has become an icon of classic Corvettes.  With stunning red paint, complimented by an exceptionally clean red interior, this convertible is sure to turn heads.  Powered by a V-8 engine that is paired with manual transmission, this quality crafted sports car is fast, fun, and fierce.  With only 19,999 miles your only challenge will be finding the proper slab of concrete to unleash this car's dashing good looks and performance oriented driving potential.

With production spanning through seven generations its easy to see why the Chevy Corvette has become a legend among American made sports cars.  This 1963 model is part of the C2 generation which introduced Sting Ray to the model.  Features included hidden headlamps, non-functional hood vents, and an independent rear-suspension.  This 1963 Corvette Sting Ray Convertible has always been stored indoors, and although it has not been driven in years it is in excellent condition both inside and out.  It was professionally appraised in 2008 and details of the appraisal are available upon request.
